{{ref improve|date=December 2011}} '''Scottish Politician of the Year''' is an annual award established in 1999. It is held by ''[[The Herald (Glasgow)|The Herald]]'' [[Scottish newspapers|newspaper]] in [[Prestonfield]], [[Edinburgh]], [[Scotland]].
Although the awards ceremony has been held once at the [[Royal Museum]], [[Prestonfield House]] Hotel is considered to be the home of the event. At the 2004 ceremony - held at the Prestonfield - former [[Scottish Labour Party|Labour]] [[Member of the Scottish Parliament|MSP]] and [[life peer]] [[Mike Watson]], set fire to a curtain, and was subsequently convicted of [[wilful fire raising]]. <ref>BBC News, [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/4269808.stm ''Fire-raising peer sent to prison''], 22 September 2005 </ref>
Not all of the subsidiary awards are handed out every year.
